MainClaim.text: "Currie's rejection of weak illusionism is sound

Untitled 1.text: "Currie's rejection of weak illusionism is unjustified."

s rejection of weak illusionism.text: "Kania's objections to Currie's rejection of weak illusionism are unsuccessful due to his failure to acknowledge the necessary conditions for cinematic experience."

Untitled 2.text: "Currie's rejection of weak illusionism is sound."

Untitled 3.text: "Kania's argument against Currie relies upon a single contention

Untitled 4.text: "Currie's view that cinematic motion is real in the weak sense

Untitled 5.text: "The experience of film is the experience of seeing moving images under specific perceptual circumstances

Untitled 6.text: "Ponech's attempt to prove that singletons exhibit garden-variety motion fails because singletons are not objects."

Untitled 7.text: "Currie's theory of cinematic motion is the most plausible of the three options."

Untitled 8.text: "The view that the illusory nature of film can be proved by slowing the projector down is doubly fallacious."

Untitled 9.text: "Currie's rejection of weak illusionism is sound because cinematic images really move
